article_title: Brazilian President’s Approval Rating Remains Low
article_text:
SÃO PAULO—Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff’s approval rating remains near historic lows, with the country mired in a deep economic downturn and an escalating political crisis, while Brazilians now consider corruption to be their country’s biggest problem, a new poll reveals.

Just 10% of respondents across the country said Ms. Rousseff’s performance was “good or excellent,” according to the results of a poll released on Sunday by the Datafolha polling institute. That is up slightly from an August figure of 8%, which was...
